summary: Technical Manager at Prime Oil & Gas in charge of  the technical activities related to geosciences, reservoir engineering, drilling, and facilities, which support the operations in the ultra-deep water fields Agbami, Akpo, Egina and Preowei (offshore Nigeria).  27 years in the Oil & Gas Industry (Exploration and Production). Master in Geophysics / Rock Physics from Stanford University. Executive MBA from IE Business School (Dean’s List and Beta Gamma Sigma). Responsibilities include Annual Reserves, Annual Budget, 5-year plan, RBL facility technical support and New Ventures. Interests include Prospect Evaluation, Production Forecast, Geological / Reservoir Models, Rock Physics, Geostatistics and Uncertainty Analysis. Formed in Corporate Finance, Corporate Strategy, Management Control and Team Leadership. profile_positions.description: Leads the technical support (hands-on) for the giant fields Agbami (production > 200.000 bbl/d) and Preowei (resources >140mmbbl; under development) at Petrobras Oil & Gas. In Agbami, works in the definition of new infills, analysis of the 4D seismic data, Agbami Gas Project, identification of reservoir management opportunities and technical interaction with partners. In Preowei, leads technical works to optimize the FDP, evaluate locations and build the geological models. Provides technical advice to M&A/New Ventures in different investments/divestments and to other fields (Akpo, Egina South, Egina, etc). Important contributor to the development and exploration strategy of the company.  Works close to reservoir, facilities, drilling and planning engineers to deliver integrated analysis. Have been responsible for the geological evaluation of different blocks located in Africa (Nigeria, Benin, Angola, Eastern African Rift, etc.). Have worked in multiple integrated studies to improve geological models (including AVO, Seismic Inversion, etc.), reduce uncertainty, quantify volumes and propose successful well locations. Performed seismic interpretations, data integration studies and QI analysis among other activities.
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Worked at the Petrobras International Division (ANI) giving technical support to different South American assets (Argentina, Bolivia, Venezuela, Mexico, Cuba, etc.) . Coordinated several integrated studies to evaluate/quantify area potentials and identify new location opportunities. 
•	Led a multidisciplinary team to quantify the potential of unconventional reservoirs –shale gas and oil– applying seismic-stratigraphic concepts in Vaca Muerta Fm., Argentina. 
•	Evaluated and ranked multiple gas prone blocks in the Sub-Andino Sur sector (Bolivia).
•	Coordinated the evaluation of several Sub-Andean basins for both Conventional and Unconventional HC resources (corporate project).
•	Performed geological evaluation of multiple exploratory blocks in different basins for possible business opportunities in conventional reservoirs (Central Bolivia, Eastern Venezuela, etc.).
profile_positions.title: Regional Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed a 15 highly-skilled professionals multidisciplinary team in charge of the evaluation of different exploratory and development assets in Venezuela, México and the Caribbean. Activities included seismic interpretation, prospect evaluation, resource and risk estimation among others.
•	Led the evaluation of a 1590 Km2 exploratory area (Block N37) located in deep to ultra-deep Cuban waters, including seismic acquisition, processing and interpretation. Quantified recoverable resources > 1.000 MMbbl in a strongly faulted and pledged carbonatic environment.
•	Led the macro project “Evaluation of Exploratory Opportunities in Latin America 2011” for the international branch of Petrobras (Argentina, Bolivia, Colombia, Venezuela and the Caribbean).
•	Identified 30+ successful locations in Cuervito and Fronterizo blocks (“tight gas reservoirs”) located in Burgos basin (México) after seismic reinterpretation and well analysis.
•	Coordinated the generation of the geological static model for the exploratory offshore block Moruy II (Gulf of Venezuela; neighbor to Perla Field) including proposals for two exploratory wells with risked recoverable resources > 2 Tcf. 
•	Coordinated the team in charge of quantifying resources in Carabobo I (OOIP > 45.000 MMbbl) located in the Orinoco heavy oil belt in Venezuela. 
•	Led the process to acquire Moruy-3D (offshore Venezuela) and N37-2D (offshore Cuba) seismic surveys. Supervised several seismic processings and reprocessings.
profile_positions.title: Exploration Manager

profile_positions.description: Interpreted different blocks/áreas in Eastern and Maracaibo basins (Venezuela). Generated several 3D static models incorporating/integrating all the existent data (petrel and Landmark suite). Proposed several successful well locations. Applied advanced geostatistical techniques for propagating petrophysical parameters into stochastic models. Review seismic attributes for fluid and lithology identification.
profile_positions.title: Senior Geophysicist

profile_positions.description: Designed and QC seismic surveys (El Furrial 3D, Bosque 3D, Carito 3D among others).  Executed seismic modeling (ray tracing and finite-differences) to optimize acquisition parameters and costs.   Worked in seismic data processings. Contributed to standardize technical aspects of acquisition contracts among PDVSA affiliates. Designed and supervised several borehole seismic logs and special seismic acquisition tests. Interpreted several seismic volumes mainly in distensive areas.
